alert.note: Alert for Graham; Haywood; Northern Jackson; Swain (North Carolina) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Greenville-Spartanburg (Western North Carolina and Northwest South Carolina)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued August 10 at 5:34AM EDT by NWS Greenville-Spartanburg
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of Macon, northwestern Jackson, Swain, Graham and northwestern Haywood Counties through 615 AM EDT... At 533 AM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from 3 miles southeast of Sevierville to 5 miles east of Murphy. Movement was northeast at 65 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 50 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Franklin, Bryson City, Robbinsville, Cherokee, Town Of Santeetlah, Smoky Mountains-Newfound Gap, Smoky Mountains-Fontana Area, Lake Santeetlah, Fontana Lake and Nantahala Lake. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...50 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with these storms and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.
